oshi.hardware

Interface HardwareAbstractionLayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LinuxHardwareAbstractionLayer, MacHardwareAbstractionLayer, WindowsHardwareAbstractionLayer

    public interface HardwareAbstractionLayer
    A hardware abstraction layer. Provides access to hardware items such as processors, memory, battery, and disks.
    Author:
    dblock[at]dblock[dot]org

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OSFileStore[] getFileStores()
      Instantiates an array of OSFileStore objects, representing a storage pool, device, partition, volume, concrete file system or other implementation specific means of file storage.
      Memory getMemory()
      Instantiates a Memory object.
      PowerSource[] getPowerSources()
      Instantiates an array of PowerSource objects, representing batteries, etc.
      Processor[] getProcessors()
      Instantiates an array of Processor objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getProcessors

        Processor[] getProcessors()
        Instantiates an array of Processor objects. This represents one or more Logical CPUs.
        Returns:
        An array of Processor objects.

      • getMemory

        Memory getMemory()
        Instantiates a Memory object.
        Returns:
        A memory object.

      • getPowerSources

        PowerSource[] getPowerSources()
        Instantiates an array of PowerSource objects, representing batteries, etc.
        Returns:
        An array of PowerSource objects or an empty array if none are present.

      • getFileStores

        OSFileStore[] getFileStores()
        Instantiates an array of OSFileStore objects, representing a storage pool, device, partition, volume, concrete file system or other implementation specific means of file storage.
        Returns:
        An array of OSFileStore objects or an empty array if none are present.
